detailedDescription:
This three bedroom apartment is located on the 6th floor. The apartment is North east facing and finished to a high specification with distinctive interior design shaped by Johnson Naylor.

Description

Visit our Brand New Showhome
Our new showhome is now available to view, created by renowned designer, Nick Auston.

We asked Nick to produce a 'Quintessentially British' interior design scheme for a 2-bedroom apartment by using small and local businesses along the King's Road. Our main aim for this showhome is to explore originality, whilst delving into the rich history of the site itself as well as surrounding area of Fulham.

In addition, the apartment brings a new meaning to the showhome concept with innovative software that allows potential purchases to interact with items in the showhome whether visiting in person or virtually. The unique technology offers an in-depth insight into the property, its interiors and the vision for King's Road Park.

Transforming London's Heritage

King's Road Park will transform a hidden part of London's heritage, to create a new sustainable neighbourhood set within a beautiful park, truly designed for life.

Situated just 60 metres from the iconic King's Road and close to the River Thames, King's Road Park is in one of south-west London's most celebrated locations. Perfectly located in Zone 2 and only a 10 minute walk from both an Underground and Overground station, this sought-after address is well connected and close to the very best that London has to offer.

King's Road Park is the last project of its scale yet to be started within the Fulham Riverside Regeneration Area and south-west London. This will see the restoration of two Grade II listed buildings set within a new public square. 100,000 sq. Ft. Of commercial space will provide a choice of restaurants, bars and offices.

*Virtual viewings available with our marketing suite staff. Book your appointment today to find out more about our latest release at King's Road Park. At present in-person viewings are permitted but we encourage a virtual viewing in the first instance.*

A collection of stylish suites, 1,2,3 and 4 bedroom apartments, a new public park with an extensive range of community facilities.

Prices from £725,000.

Location
As part of the Fulham regeneration area, King's Road Park will see the restoration of two Grade II listed buildings, set within new public square and contemporary designed commercial space. The development is situated just 60 metres from the King's Road in Chelsea and a stones through to the River Thames.

The Zone two location is within easy reach of Fulham Broadway Underground station (15 minutes to Victoria on the District Line), and Imperial Wharf Overground station, taking you one stop to Clapham Junction south of the river.

Amenities
Residents will benefit from a beautiful landscaped public park at the centre of the development, providing a significant open space for the local community. The development provides access to luxury health and fitness facilities featuring a gymnasium and studios, 25m swimming pool with vitality pool, steam room, sauna and treatment rooms. Finally, residents will enjoy private access to a cinema, golf simulator and games room.

The ground floor and first floors feature an elegant lobby with a 24-hour concierge, a private dining room and meeting rooms, with a private bar, a relaxing work space and communal gardens.

Images are CGIs and indicative only.

Square Footage: 1178 sq ft

detailedDescription: A light and generously proportioned upper maisonette over first and second floors of this good looking Victorian building - handily located for tubes. It has a lovely original first floor reception room with fireplace and eat-in kitchen behind - these spaces could be knocked through to create a more open feel. There are three bedrooms - or two doubles and a study on the second floor. The large loft area is owned by the joint freeholders, but has scope for development subject to their agreement to sell their loft interest, and the usual planning permission. The property is in the mid section of Cathnor Road, a good distance off Goldhawk Road. Both Ravenscourt Park and Askew Road are within a short walk. The shopping and transports hubs of Hammersmith and Westfield are within easy reach and Goldhawk Road tube is a few minutes walk - as are excellent local nurseries and schools.

address: Apex Court, 1 Woodger Road, London W12
detailedDescription:
A wonderful opportunity to purchase this modern one bedroom apartment with stunning far-reaching views from the private roof terrace.

Location

Excellently located in the heart of Shepherd's Bush, Apex Court benefits from superb transport links; with access to the Circle and Hammersmith and City Line from Goldhawk road approximately 0.1 miles away and the Central line Underground and Overground lines from Shepherds Bush within 0.3 miles. The area offers substantial shopping facilities at the Westfield Centre with an abundance of restaurants, shops and a multiplex cinema.

Description

A wonderful opportunity to purchase this modern one bedroom apartment with stunning far-reaching views. Located on the fourth floor and offering open-plan living space this apartment is ideal for entertaining.

The open-plan kitchen features a peninsular and excellent built in appliances and storage. The reception area leads off from the kitchen and offers plenty of natural light through the large windows and double glass doors, presenting access to the spacious private roof terrace.

The master bedroom offers excellent privacy and has the additional advantage of a bespoke built-in wardrobe. The family bathroom sits opposite the bedroom.

Square Footage: 474 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 118 years remaining

detailedDescription:
This expansive period house comprises of a spacious entrance hall leading to the open plan kitchen/dining room with bi-folding doors to the West facing garden and a skylight that floods the space with natural light. Adjoining this is the reception room that has space for both a lounge and home office.

There are two staircases that lead down to the lower ground floor that provides a further reception area, a utility with shower room and a second separate WC. To the rear of the property is a spacious 39'5 ft garden that has been laid to paving with raised shrub beds.

On the first floor is the spacious principal bedroom is located on the first floor, this elegant room boasts tall ceilings, built-in cupboards, a large ensuite, and floor-length French doors that lead out onto a balcony that enviably overlooks Parsons Green. Adjacent is a shower room and a bedroom/study with doors onto the terrace.

The second floor offers two double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes and a family bathroom. There is a further double bedroom on the third floor with dual aspect windows, a large shower room, and eaves storage.

This is an elegant home in the heart of Parsons Green.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options that may be available to you. These could include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography. Call the team to discuss further.

Parsons Green is the road to the west of Parsons Green. As such it is moments from Parsons Green Underground station (District line) and numerous bus routes along New Kings Road and Fulham Road and all the shops, bars and restaurants of the area. Fulham is renowned for its sense of community and a wonderful area for young families including the 5 local private primary schools.

detailedDescription:
• 5 bedrooms
• 4 bathrooms
• Spacious Victorian property. Approximate gross floor area 2179 f2 / 203 m2
• We understand planning consent has been obtained in the past (now expired) for conversion into 2 duplex units if required
• Lawful development rights to extend the home under single family dwelling rights to create a ground floor side extension adjoining the kitchen
• Good strategic location in fashionable Parsons Green with easy access to Parsons Green Underground Station, buses, shops, restaurants
• Family home in good decorative condition

Property description
A large and tastefully decorated family home offering spacious accommodation, a short walk to Parsons Green. The house has generous and elegant proportions including 5 bedrooms, 4 bathrooms, as well as a large double reception room with high ceilings, wood floors and plaster cornicing. There is a spacious American style kitchen/breakfast room with doors leading onto a compact rear patio.

Planning permission was granted in the past for conversion (now expired) to convert into two maisonettes, details of which can be found on the Hammersmith & Fulham planning portal. The property may benefit from some adjustments according to the buyer’s preference and upgrading would enhance the property and value.

The house is located on the best section of Munster Road between Fulham Road & the New Kings Road, in close proximity to the shops, restaurants of Parsons Green itself. The closest London underground station is Parsons Green (District Line, Zone 2) which is within walking distance and regular bus services are within walking distance.

This freehold house represents an excellent investment or family home.

detailedDescription:
Summary
A beautifully positioned mansion block apartment situated on the third floor of this new development with a large balcony looking onto the RIver Thames. There is underground parking and a concierge.

Description
A beautifully positioned mansion block apartment situated on the third floor of this new development along the Fulham riverside with great connections into the city centre from both Imperial Wharf station and Fulham Broadway station as well as Parsons Green tube station and Wandsworth town train station (15 mins to waterloo).
The apartment has a large balcony accessed from the main reception room and one of the bedrooms. All the main rooms look towards the River Thames. The master bedroom has a large en-suite, and there is a second bathroom, both are immaculately presented. Both bedrooms are large, open and airy, and host windows facing the river.
The hallway accesses all rooms. The open plan kitchen and living space looks south over the river from its balcony. There is a smart airflow system to continuously refresh the air supply.
The property comes with an underground parking lot and there is an on-site concierge.
Being along the Fulham riverside means close access to the Hurlingham club, Chelsea Harbour club, South Park and Hurlingham Park.

address: Comeragh Road, Barons Court, West Kensington, London W14
detailedDescription:
In the heart of West Kensington is where you will find this lovely, newly refurbished 2-bedroom split level apartment. The first floor is where you will find the bright and airy open plan reception and dining room perfectly laid out for entertaining. The area consists of 3-meter-high ceilings, original marble Victorian fireplace, double glazed sash windows and solid oak floors leading to a south facing balcony. This space also allows for easy closing off to create a 3rd bedroom should the need arise. Just off from the reception and dining room, is the fully fitted kitchen.

As you make your way up to the second floor, this is where you will find a spacious bathroom for both family and guests. Continuing up to the third floor which offers 2 generous double bedrooms, the Master bedroom fitted with wardrobes, and a modern en-suite bathroom. On top of all of this, a hidden gem can be found as this beautiful property has a fantastic decked roof terrace with hidden BBQ cleverly built into the chimney stack.

The location of this property allows for each access to all local amenities, shops located beside Barons Court tube station and motorists have easy access to the A4/M4 for routes in and out of London. The nearest Undergrounds to this property are West Kensington (District) and Barons Court (Piccadilly & District).

detailedDescription:
A stylish Victorian family home with scope to extend, located on Wardo Avenue, one of Munster Village's most popular roads

This beautiful and bright three bedroom Victorian family home, is arranged over three floors and extending to almost 2,000 sq ft. On the ground floor there is a sizeable double reception room, a step down leads through to an extended kitchen with a central island, excellent storage and further space for dining. Sliding doors lead out onto a South facing private garden. There is also access to a cellar. On the first floor there are two double bedrooms with build in storage, a large family bathroom and very useful utility room. The loft has been converted to create a further double bedroom and a separate shower room. There is also further scope to extend, adding a fourth bedroom in the form of a ‘pod room’ over the rear addition of the house, subject to obtaining planning permission.

Wardo Avenue is very popular with families because of its residential location in the heart of Munster Village. It's also only a short walk from Fulham Road where you can find numerous boutique shops, restaurants and cafes and Munster Road itself is also just at the end of the road where there are a variety of amenities including some popular restaurants and independent cafes. You can catch regular buses from both the Fulham Road and Fulham Palace Road to various destinations and Parsons Green (District Line, Zone 2) is only a short walk away, as is the incredibly popular and recently restored Bishops Park, Fulham Palace and Thames riverside walk.

detailedDescription:
Fantastic apartment in the Television Centre with views of Hammersmith Park.

Location

Located in the heart of White City. The former bbc Television Centre sits on Wood lane, next to Westfield West London. With White City Station (approximately 0.1 mile, Central line), Wood Lane (approximately 0.1 mile, Hammersmith & City and Circle lines) and Shepherds Bush (approximately 0.6 miles, Central line and Overground lines) stations on your doorstep. Television Centre is served by excellent Underground, Overground, bus and road routes into the West End, the City and Canary Wharf.

This historic forecourt offers many restaurants, cinema, television studios, health club, spa and Soho House. Ideally located with access to the glorious open space of Hammersmith Park boasting a Japanese Garden, a gated children's play area, bowling green, tennis courts and five-aside football pitches.

Description

A fantastic apartment in the Television Centre located within the Crescent of this iconic development.

Overlooking Hammersmith Park this fabulous apartment presents wonderful entertaining space featuring an open-plan Italian Dada kitchen, Terrazzo stone worktops and a moveable island. The kitchen further benefits from built-in appliances and an abundance of storage.

The reception area leads off from the kitchen and allows access to the private balcony through floor to ceiling glass sliding doors, offering views over the beautiful Hammersmith Park.

The principal bedroom is situated to the rear of the property offering bespoke built-in storage and the advantage of large windows allowing for plenty of natural light to enter the apartment. The bathroom sits opposite.

Television Centre offers excellent local amenities and access to the private members gym, swimming pool, screening room and 24hr concierge.

Square Footage: 592 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 994 years remaining

Chelsea Studios is moments from the transport links of London Underground and the shops, boutiques and restaurants of the fashionable King’s Road.

address: King's Road Park, King's Road, London SW6
detailedDescription:
King's Road Park is a collection of suites, 1,2,3 and 4 bedroom apartments and penthouses set within 6 acres of beautiful landscaping including a public park, square and residents' gardens

Description

Visit our Brand New Showhome
Our new showhome is now available to view, created by renowned designer, Nick Auston.

We asked Nick to produce a 'Quintessentially British' interior design scheme for a 2-bedroom apartment by using small and local businesses along the King's Road. Our main aim for this showhome is to explore originality, whilst delving into the rich history of the site itself as well as surrounding area of Fulham.

In addition, the apartment brings a new meaning to the showhome concept with innovative software that allows potential purchases to interact with items in the showhome whether visiting in person or virtually. The unique technology offers an in-depth insight into the property, its interiors and the vision for King's Road Park.

Transforming London's Heritage

King's Road Park will transform a hidden part of London's heritage, to create a new sustainable neighbourhood set within a beautiful park, truly designed for life.

Situated just 60 metres from the iconic King's Road and close to the River Thames, King's Road Park is in one of south-west London's most celebrated locations. Perfectly located in Zone 2 and only a 10 minute walk from both an Underground and Overground station, this sought-after address is well connected and close to the very best that London has to offer.

King's Road Park is the last project of its scale yet to be started within the Fulham Riverside Regeneration Area and south-west London. This will see the restoration of two Grade II listed buildings set within a new public square. 100,000 sq. Ft. Of commercial space will provide a choice of restaurants, bars and offices.

*Virtual viewings available with our marketing suite staff. Book your appointment today to find out more about our latest release at King's Road Park. At present in-person viewings are permitted but we encourage a virtual viewing in the first instance.*

A collection of stylish suites, 1,2,3 and 4 bedroom apartments, a new public park with an extensive range of community facilities.

Prices from £725,000.

Location
As part of the Fulham regeneration area, King's Road Park will see the restoration of two Grade II listed buildings, set within new public square and contemporary designed commercial space. The development is situated just 60 metres from the King's Road in Chelsea and a stones through to the River Thames.

The Zone two location is within easy reach of Fulham Broadway Underground station (15 minutes to Victoria on the District Line), and Imperial Wharf Overground station, taking you one stop to Clapham Junction south of the river.

Amenities
Residents will benefit from a beautiful landscaped public park at the centre of the development, providing a significant open space for the local community. The development provides access to luxury health and fitness facilities featuring a gymnasium and studios, 25m swimming pool with vitality pool, steam room, sauna and treatment rooms. Finally, residents will enjoy private access to a cinema, golf simulator and games room.

The ground floor and first floors feature an elegant lobby with a 24-hour concierge, a private dining room and meeting rooms, with a private bar, a relaxing work space and communal gardens.

Images are CGIs and indicative only.

Square Footage: 890 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 999 years remaining

detailedDescription:
A substantial house of over 3,000 sq ft on this sought after street close to Fulham Broadway

Location

Walham Grove is one of the most sought after streets in the area due to its ideal positioning for easy access to both South Kensington and Chelsea, Heathrow Airport and all the local amenities, schools and services of Fulham.
The nearest underground station is Fulham Broadway which is approximately 0.4 miles away.
The area has an excellent selection of nursery and primary schools.

Description

This impressive, grand and substantial family house is wider and taller than the average Fulham home and offers spacious, bright and well proportioned rooms throughout.
On the raised ground floor is an open double reception room with dark wood flooring, pretty cornicing and an attractive fireplace. There is also a study on this floor with French windows opening to a balcony which has spiral stairs down to the garden. The beautiful 43ft garden is south west facing and has a number of mature trees and a useful shed.
The property was built with a lower ground floor which has a wonderful flow with a reception/family room leading through to a dining room which then leads to a modern kitchen. French windows open from the dining room to the garden. There is also a separate utility room, a guest cloakroom and an underfloor wine cellar.
Upstairs are are five double bedrooms (two en suite) with fitted wardrobes, a family bathroom and a further kitchen.
The property offers tremendous scope for further development subject to the necessary planning consent.

Square Footage: 3100 sq ft

detailedDescription:
This wonderfully bright four-bedroom house is configured across four storeys on Macfarlane Road, a quiet residential street near Shepherd’s Bush Green. The house has been the subject of a comprehensive renovation in recent years; most significantly it has been extended out into the back garden to create an expansive open-plan kitchen and dining room, bathed in natural light.

The Tour

The house is part of an elegant terrace formed largely of three-storey Victorian townhouses, their façades characterised by bay windows on the first and second floors and occasional white stucco adornments. This particular house is set back behind a small front yard with wrought iron railings and five young trees.

Upon entry, the house appears to retain its original proportions. However, closer inspection reveals that the entrance hall has been substantially widened towards the middle of the plan, creating space for a utility room, cloakroom and guest WC. A traditional living room sits at the front of the plan, nestled within the bay window; it has a wood-burning stove and engineered oak boards run underfoot. However, beyond the entrance hall, the house transforms into something entirely modern in its aesthetic.

The plan drops down a few steps into a fantastic open-plan kitchen and dining room. Natural light floods in through angled skylights in the side-return extension and glazed doors leading directly onto the garden. Marble worktops have been used for the kitchen and breakfast bar; the space also contains a butler sink and smart Zelig splashback tiles, with large-format terrazzo tiles running underfoot.

The main bedroom lies at the front of the first-floor plan, with a bay window, walk-in dressing room and en suite shower room with twin sinks. There is a slightly smaller bedroom overlooking the garden at the rear on this floor. The second floor is home to a large family bathroom and a third bedroom with fitted wardrobes and elevated views over Macfarlane Road. There is a large freestanding bath in the bathroom and a continuation of the terrazzo flooring theme.

A second en suite bedroom can be found on the third floor. It has glazed windows that open to a charming Juliet balcony, a large skylight and significant amounts of storage space within the eaves. In addition to the substantial storage within each bedroom, there is a well-sized cellar, ideal for more cumbersome items.

Outdoor Space

The garden is a good size and laid mostly to lawn. There is a patio area, accessible directly from the dining room, and raised beds to one side formed of large timber planks. The garden walls are brick on the lower levels and wooden trellises run above.

The Area

Macfarlane Road is a short walk from the shops, restaurants and bars of Shepherd’s Bush Green. The area is also home to one of London’s Westfield centres. The recently renovated Television Centre is at the centre of an exciting regeneration in nearby Wood Lane, where independent restaurants such as Kricket have opened in recent years, along with a cinema and the new Soho House members’ club at White City. Also nearby is White City Place, a creative campus with restaurants, shops and museums, and the rca’s Schools of Communication, Humanities, and Architecture. The house is within the catchment area of St Stephen’s Church of England Primary School, an ofsted-rated “outstanding” local primary.

Public transport links are accessed via Shepherds Bush (Central Line, Southern Rail, London Overground and bus station) and Shepherd’s Bush Market (Circle and Hammersmith & City Lines).

detailedDescription:
A fabulous lateral flat in an atmospheric converted mill, conveniently located for access to Shepherds Bush and Holland Park.

Presented in immaculate condition, accommodation briefly comprises; entrance hallway with built-in storage leading to a generous open-plan kitchen / reception room, two double bedrooms, modern family bathroom and a large private terrace. Both bedrooms benefit from built-in wardrobes and the master bed also has direct access to the terrace. The reception room has excellent light from the full width and height windows and there is terrific feeling of space throughout.

Excellent shopping and dining opportunities can be found nearby in Shepherds Bush, Holland Park and Notting Hill. There is an abundance of green space on the doorstep and transport links from Shepherds Bush and Goldhawk Road stations provide easy access to the City, West End and Canary Wharf.

Offered with a share of the freehold.

detailedDescription:
A contemporary three bedroom mews house located in a gated development

Location

Salisbury Mews is set within a wonderfully secluded spot approximately 0.6 miles from Fulham Broadway, this impressive mews house offers numerous benefits including the luxury of off street parking and private gated access.

Description

This bright townhouse is set out over three floors, offering both spacious and contemporary living.

On entering the property you will find a generous reception room with bi-folding doors out to a terrace. There is then a separate study/bedroom with modern bathroom.

The lower ground floor features a large open plan kitchen/dining room, benefitting from bi-folding doors out to a private patio garden, creating the perfect space for entertaining. This floor further benefits from a storage/playroom area. There is also a guest W.C.

The first floor hosts two large double bedrooms both with en-suite bathrooms. The larger of the two also has sliding doors out to a balcony.

detailedDescription:
A stunning four bedroom house finished to the highest standard located on the Fulham/Chelsea border

Location

Waterford Road runs between Kings Road and Fulham Road and is therefore ideally situated for the excellent shops, restaurants and facilities both at Fulham Broadway and in Chelsea. The property is approximately 0.2 miles from Fulham Broadway underground station (District Line).
The area boasts an excellent choice of nursery and primary schools.

Description

This property has been beautifully finished throughout with dark wood flooring, underfloor heating and bespoke joinery.
The lower ground floor has a fantastic contemporary kitchen with marble worktops and integrated appliances are a mix of Wolf & Miele. There is a separate pantry and plenty of space for dining . Bi-fold doors open on to a south west facing patio garden. There is also a guest bedroom with separate shower room and utility area on this floor.
The raised ground floor has a stylish formal reception room with dark wood flooring and attractive fireplace to the front and a bright sitting area to the rear with French windows opening to a terrace which overlooks the garden.
On the first floor are two double bedrooms (one of which has access to a balcony) and a family bathroom.
On the second floor is an elegant principal suite with excellent storage space and en suite bathroom.

Square Footage: 2061 sq ft

detailedDescription:
This exquisite four double bedroom apartment is within the prestigious Fulham Riverside development, it is finished to exacting standards over two floors and has been beautifully designed throughout.

The entry level comprises of three large double bedrooms. The master bedroom is complete with a luxuriously appointed en-suite bathroom with vanity units. There are two further double bedrooms on this level, both with built in storage and another separate bathroom.

The upper level offers another guest bedroom with built in storage. As well a vast open plan reception/dining room offering fantastic entertaining space, with stunning bespoke cabinetry and attractive views of the River Thames. The state of the art kitchen is fully equipped with integrated Miele appliances. The spacious dining room leads to a balcony with scenic views of the river, finished with hardwood decking and bespoke lighting. Perfect for outdoor entertainment. The apartment is fully equipped with state of art comfort cooling, underfloor heating and surround sound.

Fulham Riverside is set around an acre of tranquil gardens planted with native trees and box hedging, consisting of water features, maze and an outdoor gym. Residents further benefit from first class facilities including a private indoor gymnasium, in addition to excellent 24-hour security and concierge service. This apartment also benefits from an allocated underground parking space.

Fulham Riverside has excellent transport links for underground, over ground and bus routes. Fulham Broadway, Parsons Green and Imperial Wharf are all within a short walking distance.

Notice
Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

detailedDescription:
An immaculately presented four bedroom family home.

Location

Shepherds Bush Road is a popular location bordering Holland Park and Kensington. This area provides an excellent variety of local shops, cafes, delicatessens and restaurants plus Westfield shopping Centre and White City's Soho house is a short walk.

The location has excellent nearby transport links with Shepherd's Bush Market station approximately 0.3 miles (Circle line and Hammersmith & City) and Shepherds Bush Station approximately 0.2 miles (Central line, Overground and National Rail). Shepherds Bush Road offers quick and easy access to the A4 taking you into central London or out to the countryside.

The property is located near to some of the best public and private schools in the area including St Stephens, St Pauls, Godolphin & Latymer Schools.

Description

This attractive four bedroom property offers a unique family home set over four floors.

Upon entrance you find a well-designed open plan reception dining room which boasts high ceilings, bay window, period cornicing and warm oak flooring. To the rear there is a study which overlooks the south east facing garden.

The lower ground floor comprises of two bedrooms with access to bathroom and a patio area.

On the first floor is a well sized double bedroom boasting a dressing room and period fire place, as well as a further room that could be a study or nursery. Adjacent is found the family bathroom which boasts roll top bath as well as walk in shower and marble top sink.

The top floor comprises of a fourth bedroom which offers plenty of built in storage, an en suite bathroom and roof top views.

Square Footage: 1694 sq ft

This fine two bedroom apartment in the excellent and sought after tvc.

Location

Television Centre is situated in West London on the edge of Shepherd's Bush next to Westfield Shopping centre amongst the overall 145 acre regeneration of White City.

This ambitious project includes the creation of a new academic hub and campus for Imperial College London, new homes and new public park, the expansion of Westfield London including the new John Lewis, and the redevelopment of the former bbc Media village into a new office quarter – White City Place.

Television Centre has easy access to London's vast established transport network. In addition to White City and Wood Lane Underground stations, the area is served by excellent Overground, bus and road routes into the West End, the City, Canary Wharf and beyond.

The nearest Underground stations are White City Station (Central line), approximately less than 0.1 miles, and Shepherd's Bush Market (Circle and Hammersmith & City lines), approximately 0.2 miles. These stations offer an excellent service to the city with a range of buses. Further access out of London to the west via the A4 and M4.

address: Thames Reach, 80 Rainville Road, Fulham, London W6
detailedDescription:
Two double bedroom apartment with superb river views.

Location

Thames Reach is situated on the north bank of the river
Thames, next to the famous River Café and the tranquil riverside walk/cycle path.

Located just 0.8 miles from Hammersmith underground station it offers easy access to Central London and out to Heathrow.

In addition to a selection of popular bars and eateries along the river, the local amenities of Fulham Palace Road are also just a short distance away.

Description

Thames Reach is a popular riverside development designed by renowned architect, Richard Rogers. This spacious two double bedroom, two bathroom apartment boasts superb uninterrupted views of the River Thames, across to the iconic Harrods Depositary building and down to Hammersmith Bridge.
The property offers over 1,100 sq ft of accommodation, featuring a large reception room with an open plan kitchen
and integrated appliances. The principle bedroom benefits from built in wardrobes and a luxurious en suite bathroom, whilst the second bedroom has use of a separate guest bathroom. Residents will benefit from excellent porter service, as well as secure underground parking in which this flat has an allocated space.

Virtual viewing available on request.

These photos were taken over six months ago.

Square Footage: 1101 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 962 years remaining

address: The Helios, Television Centre, Wood Lane, London W12
detailedDescription:
Brilliantly positioned on the third floor of Television Centre’s Helios building is this bright one-bedroom apartment. It was built to a design by riba award-winning architects Allford Hall Monaghan Morris and has interiors designed by Studio Ashby.

A landmark piece of modern architecture, Television Centre was the home of the bbc for over 50 years until its relocation in 2012. At its core is The Helios, a circular Grade ii-listed modernist structure arranged around a central fountain, with a beautiful mosaic-tiled exterior and arresting central staircase visible through soaring glazing. A boundary is formed by the newly added Crescent, with private gardens between the two buildings.

Residents of Television Centre enjoy a range of brilliantly executed amenities, including access to the Soho House gym and swimming pool, a private cinema, 24-hour concierge, and an excellent residents’ lounge with work and meeting spaces.

The Tour

Internal accommodation extends to over 600 sq ft and is accessed via either a lift or a spectacular cantilevered staircase, the world’s largest when it was installed in 1960. Entry is to an open-plan living room, kitchen and dining room with wall-to-wall windows that offer a remarkable perspective through the Grade ii-listed façade, looking towards the Helios statue and fountain of the central courtyard. These have been updated with double glazing while retaining the aesthetic of the original steel frames, in deference to the building’s history and listed status.

Studio Ashby’s careful intervention employs a palette of soft greys and deep greens to reflect the distinctive colours of the building’s exterior. Bespoke cabinetry lines one wall of the living space, creating storage and bookshelves and concealing a television unit. Respecting the integrity of the original structure, a ribbed section of the concrete ceilings has been revealed here, which rise to three meters at their full height.

The open-plan kitchen has terrazzo worktops, handleless Italian-designed units and appliances by Siemens. Polished screed, with underfloor heating, extends across this and the entrance hall; there is comfort cooling throughout. The substantial glazing of the living space is mirrored in the bedroom, a bright space flooded with light. Adjacent to this is the dressing room and bathroom, clad with bespoke tiles designed by the architects.

The Area

Television Centre is located at the epicentre of the exciting regeneration of White City and Shepherd’s Bush. Independent restaurants such as Kricket and the new Soho House members’ club, White City House, are close by. Also nearby is White City Place, a creative campus with restaurants, shops and museums, and the new home of rca’s Schools of Communication, Humanities, and Architecture.

White City Underground station is three minutes’ walk from Television Centre and is served by the Central Line. Shepherd’s Bush Station is also within walking distance, for Overground services, and the Westway provides routes out of London.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: Approx. 972 years remaining
Service charge: Approx. £5,110 per annum (including repairs to shared areas and the outside of the building, cleaning services, concierge or caretaker, communal garden, CCTV)
Ground Rent: Approx. £450 per annum

Photographer: Alexander James

detailedDescription:
A fantastic apartment within the iconic Television Centre.

Location

Located in the heart of White City. The former bbc Television Centre sits on Wood lane, next to Westfield West London.

White City Station (approximately 0.1 mile, Central line), Wood Lane (approximately 0.1 mile, Hammersmith & City and Circle lines) and Shepherds Bush (approximately 0.6 miles, Central line and Overground lines) stations on your doorstep.

Television Centre is served by excellent Underground, Overground, bus and road routes into the West End, the City and Canary Wharf. The historic forecourt offers many restaurants, cinema, television studios, health club, spa and a Soho House.

Ideally located with access to the glorious open space of Hammersmith Park boasting a Japanese Garden, a gated children's play area, bowling green, tennis courts and five-a-side football pitches.

Description

A fantastic apartment located within the iconic Television Centre.

This apartment has been designed to a high standard featuring high ceilings and fantastic wide windows allowing for an abundance of natural light to enter the apartment. The principal bedroom can be found upon entrance to the apartment offering a bespoke walk-in wardrobe. The bathroom sits alongside the bedroom offering a walk-in shower.

The modern, open-plan kitchen offers plenty of modern appliances and bespoke built-in storage. The reception boasts excellent entertaining space with fantastic views and an abundance of natural light.

Applicant Note:
This flat does have views of the current construction of 1 Wood Crescent. This particular site oversees the building of an office block constructed over basement, ground and 9 upper floors and will comprise, once finished, circa 100,000 sq ft of offices which has started and will last until Q1 2023. Work starts at 8am to 6pm Monday to Friday.

address: Harrington Court, 112 Devonport Road, London W12
detailedDescription:
Newly build in 2015 this excellent two bedroom apartment combines the best of modern efficiency and build quality with the proportions and design of the surrounding period properties. There is no need to accept the compromises of conversions here as the space has been cleverly designed to maximise the movement of natural light with none of the awkward little fudges one gets when dividing the first floor of an old house into a self -contained unit. The insulation for both sound and heat is exemplary and the building is still subject to guarantees. All as one would expect in a 21st century flat but what surprises and delights is the height of the ceilings and the size of the windows which is as one would expect in a grand Victorian home - the best of both worlds. The accommodation comprises two double bedrooms, an open plan kitchen/reception and a well-appointed bathroom.

N.B - This development does not have the right to a parking permit from the local authority, the London Borough of Hammersmith & Fulham.

Location:
Located on the popular Devonport Road in the heart of Shepherds Bush, this property is just a short walk from the green and its excellent transport links, vibrant collection of shops, bars and restaurants including Westfield London and bbc development with Soho house amongst its offerings. Devonport road is a pleasant tree lined residential street conveniently located between Uxbridge and Goldhawk Roads.

This beautifully presented and wider than average house is elegantly arranged over four floors and offers contemporary décor alongside well-proportioned rooms throughout. Stairs lead to the lower ground floor comprising a fully fitted kitchen, with plenty of space for both formal and informal entertaining and a further reception area. detailedDescription:
Hamilton Property is delighted to present this impressive, recently refurbished, one bedroom duplex apartment, located in what is widely considered to be one of Parsons Green's most fashionable and sought after addresses.

Situated on the second and third floors of a well presented building, the first level of this duplex comprises an immaculate open planned kitchen and dining space which proceeds to a bright and airy south facing reception that has been thoughtfully designed so as to maximise both light and space - which further benefits from wooden flooring throughout.

A smart hallway and staircase leads up to a generous landing which guides you to an ample sized contemporary bathroom (with both bath and shower) and a commodious double bedroom, which benefits from charming panoramic views overlooking the 'Lion Houses' of Fulham and their tree lined surrounds.
The bedroom further benefits from custom made built in wardrobes - designed to ensure maximum storage space.

The entirety of the flat is positioned to the rear of the building resulting in quiescent surrounds and a peaceful, noiseless ambience throughout.

The flat is located on the south side of the New Kings Road, minutes from Parsons Green and it's tube station as well as the exciting range of amenities on offer throughout the immediate area - you are also a short walk away from the open spaces of both Bishops Park and Hurlingham park as well as the exclusive Hurlingham Club.

Leasehold - 154 years remain unexpired

Ground rent - £0

Service Charge - £250.00 per annum

agency_name: RiverHomes, South West & Central London Branch
detailedDescription: This Trader 41+2 is a very comfortable and spacious boat which offers both city living and Thames cruising opportunities. The main saloon is light and airy with large opening windows and a good size seating area with adjustable central table. The saloon also has a good deal of storage space, with lockers running along port side. Steps lead down to the galley which has a combination oven, fridge/freezer, and a stainless-steel double sink with draining board. In the bow there is a second cabin with twin beds that can be made into one double bed. There is a forward shower room with basin and WC. The main cabin is in the stern, with a double bed and plenty of storage with recessed shelving, drawers and two hanging lockers. There is an en suite toilet fitted with a sink unit, wc and a bath/shower. The third cabin on the port side is configured as a single berth which can be converted into a desk. Moored at the exclusive Imperial Wharf she is close to the shops, restaurants and bars of Chelsea and Fulham. Imperial Wharf station offers excellent connections to both National Rail and district line trains, whilst the Thames Clipper taxi service stops at the nearby Chelsea Design Centre pier.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are delighted to introduce this spacious first and second floor, split-level, Victorian conversion to the market, located on a quiet residential street in Hammersmith. The property is close to Barons Court, West Kensington and Hammersmith tube stations, with West Bromton station just down the road too - all running either Piccadilly, District or Overground services. This wonderful home also has a share of the freehold with downstairs.

The property not only suits the daily commuter, but is ideal for schooling with over two dozen primary, secondary and private schools within a 1 mile proximity, although we advice each individual to check the catchment, religious and grade requirements for these schools.

This spacious split level maisonette comprises of; an entrance hallway and staircase to the first floor landing, a good size kitchen and breakfast area, a bathroom, spacious living room, bedroom two and a second set of stairs which take you to the second floor and master bedroom - there is space and piping for a second bathroom/en-suite if desired.

There are a number of shops and restaurants nearby in the Munster Village area and along the Fulham Palace Road including; Waitrose, Sainsburys, Café Nero, Pret-a-Manger, Loco Locale and The Crabtree Pub. Several bus services run regularly on many of the nearby roads with several routes in and out of Central London.

Lease Information

Share of freehold.
Lease Term: 125 years from 25 March 1995
Ground rent: £10 (not collected due to nature of share of freehold)

This outstanding connectivity, combined with excellent restaurants and pubs, open spaces and beautiful riverside setting, thriving business opportunities and rich cultural life including the Hammersmith Apollo and the Lyric Theatre puts you at the centre of this diverse, dynamic neighbourhood.

address: Stamford Brook Avenue, Stamford Brook W6
detailedDescription:
This bright and airy property is located on the ground floor of a well-maintained building which is situated on an attractive street adjacent to Stamford Brook Common. The flat is made up of a spacious reception room, a separate kitchen with integrated appliances and a double bedroom with an en-suite bathroom. There is also an additional double bedroom and family bathroom with a shower. All the windows in the property have been replaced and you have a south and east facing aspect. From the kitchen there are lovely views of Stamford brook Common. The apartment comes with two allocated off-street parking spaces and a long lease of over 900 years. The internal communal areas of the building are newly refurbished.

Stamford Brook Avenue is a leafy residential street which is nestled between Chiswick and Hammersmith. For transport links, the district line can be found at Stamford Brook Underground station which is a short stroll away and takes you in and out of central London. The green spaces of Ravenscourt Park are very close by for leisure activities and for shopping and eating out there are ample independent coffee shops and other amenities situated on Chiswick High Road, King Street and heading into Askew village.

detailedDescription:
This attractive four bedroom Victorian townhouse is situated on one of the desirable streets that form the sought after Brackenbury Village area.

This unique house retains many Victorian features and largely reflects the original layout, with especially high ceilings on each main floor. The accommodation is arranged over three floors and offers just under 1,700 sq ft of flexible living space, with four bedrooms, two reception rooms, utility room, two bathrooms, kitchen, useful first floor dressing room, and courtyard style rear garden.

Overstone Road runs off Glenthorne Road therefore offering easy access to the various transport links at Hammersmith Broadway, including excellent shopping and restaurant facilities along King Street, and further afield at Westfield Shopping Centre. The immediate area also has excellent schooling facilities.

Gledstanes Road is a quiet and popular residential location within Barons Court, just three hundred yards from Barons Court underground (Piccadilly and District Lines). The parade of shops on Pallister Road is even closer, whilst amenities on North End Road and Kensington High Street are within walking distance. The underground stations and the A4 give easy access into and out of Central London.

detailedDescription:
Summary
This is a stunning two bedroom property in the heart of Barons Court. It is situated in a grand Victorian building, on the doorstep of Queens Club and a stone's throw from Barons Court Station.

Description
The property is entered on the first floor and is in a great condition throughout. It spans the entire second floor of the building, with sole access to the rooftop. It has been recently renovated, managing to retain beautiful period features, whilst combining them with a modern finish to create a chic and elegant feel.
At the front of the building is a large sitting room, with custom built cabinetry, solid wooden floors and original coving. There is space for both dining and relaxation, with fantastic views over both the Queens Club and the pretty white stucco fronted street. There is a semi separate kitchen, which has plenty of storage and workspace, with inbuilt appliances. The second bedroom is also at the front and has room for a double bed and storage.
There is a large master bedroom at the back of the property, with views over the tree tops into the park and a generous family bathroom in a neutral suite, with bathtub and overhead shower. The property oozes charm and is flooded with natural light from both sides. There is also plenty of inbuilt storage throughout.
The property is 0.1 miles from Barons Court Station (District and Piccadilly Lines) and 0.3 miles from West Kensington Station (District Line). There are many local amenities, including a butchers, pub and café a short walk away.

detailedDescription: A wonderful two-bedroom apartment on the ninth floor within this popular 1930s Art Deco building. This charming apartment is located in the beautiful Kings Court, moments from Ravenscourt Park, one of Hammersmith and Fulham&rsquo;s flagship parks. The property comprises a spacious reception room, separate kitchen and contemporary bathroom suite with bath. The property has good built-in storage and extensive views across West London. Kings Court is serviced by several lifts and a concierge service. The flat is situated between Ravenscourt Park and Stamford Brook tube stations, providing access to the District Line and within 1-2 stops of Hammersmith Station which services the Piccadilly, Hammersmith and City and Circle lines. The property is also ideally located for those with a car, as the A40 and M4 are within a short distance making getting into Central London and surrounding areas of West London easily accessible. The property is within walking distance of Hammersmith&rsquo;s King Street, Hammersmith Broadway and the popular Chiswick High Road. The amenities include numerous restaurants, bars and shops, including various independent boutiques but also popular high street names. The River Thames is also within short walking distance which provides the perfect walking scenery and popular pubs to stop along the way. The property is perfect for both first time buyers and investors.

detailedDescription: A charming and elegant five bedroom detached family home, set along a quiet tree lined street overlooking Ravenscourt Park. The accommodation is arranged over three floors and is presented in good decorative order. The house is well positioned and offers wonderful views across Ravenscourt Park, as well as a secluded aspect to the rear. The ground floor comprises wide entrance hallway, study, W.C, garage with off street parking, snug which could be used as a sixth bedroom, kitchen and dining room which leads to a 32ft west facing garden. The first floor comprises reception room with a balcony and stairs down to the garden, two double bedrooms both with en suite bathrooms and a balcony in the master bedroom. The third floor comprises three double bedrooms and one bathroom. There are ample storage throughout the house as well as a wonderful flow of natural light . Ravenscourt Square is conveniently located for Ravenscourt Park Underground station, as well as the excellent array of shops, bars and restaurants on both Hammersmith, King Street and Chiswick High Road. There are top independent schools close by, including St Paul's and Latymer Upper.

This one bedroom apartment spans over 590 sq.ft / 55 sq.M and offers a large double bedroom, family sized bathroom and a bright and airy open plan kitchen and living area with doors onto a private terrace.

Cranston Court is a modern development on Bloemfontein Road and is ideally located within a short walking distance from a string of shops, bars and restaurants in central Shepherd's Bush as well as the popular Westfield shopping centre. Shepherds Bush Market and White City tube stations are not more than 8 mins away and a number of excellent bus routes are available. detailedDescription:
A modern two double bedroom garden property situated in this modern development in the Sands End/Imperial Wharf area of Fulham.

The property still benefits from an existing NHBC guarantee and has been kept immaculately. The apartment consists of two double bedrooms, two bathrooms (one en-suite), an open plan kitchen, dining and reception room that leads out onto the easily maintained patio and Astroturf garden. The apartment benefits from concierge, wooden floors throughout and access to communal gardens and parks.

Tescos Express is nearby, while the Sainsburys super store is a short walk away. A 15 minute walk takes you to the Kings Road, the nightlife of Fulham Broadway and the tube, while the Imperial Wharf station could not be more conveniently located.

Private parking space available via separate negotiation.

A beautifully presented first floor duplex apartment with its own front door, situated on this charming Terrace in Fulham. detailedDescription:
This beautifully presented and wider than average five bedroomed house is elegantly arranged over four floors and offers contemporary décor alongside well-proportioned rooms throughout.

Entering on the raised ground floor the property boasts a large double reception room with feature fireplace and beautiful bay window. Stairs lead to the lower ground floor comprising a fully fitted kitchen, with plenty of space for both formal and informal entertaining and a further reception area. A guest WC is located on this level and the house further benefits from direct access to the lower ground floor from street level. French doors lead to the well maintained rear garden. Bedroom accommodation is arranged over three floors to provide five double bedrooms, all with an en-suite shower rooms, which is extremely rare for a property of this nature. Electric gates accessed from Bagleys Lane open to provide off street parking for two cars. Due to its positon on the end of a pretty terrace, natural light floods the property on every floor from its triple aspect.

The boutiques, delis and restaurants of Parsons Green are a short stroll away and the transport links of Fulham Broadway are within a few minutes’ walk. Eel Brook common is within striking distance, as are the antique shops of the fashionable Kings Road.

detailedDescription:
Full description The ground floor accommodation comprises an entrance hallway which leads through to a wonderful open plan reception room and kitchen with dining area. This room is flooded with natural light and is the perfect place in which to relax or entertain. There are sliding doors leading out onto a charming private garden with a southerly aspect. Also looking over the garden is a study which leads through to a double bedroom with built in storage along one wall and an en-suite bathroom with shower. Towards the rear is another double bedroom with a mezzanine area which can be used as a TV area. There is an en-suite jack and jill shower room which also doubles as a guest cloakroom. There is also a large garage which accommodates two cars which in turn leads through to an office area with a shower room and kitchen which could also be used as another bedroom.

Accessed through a separate front door, there is a first and second floor maisonette also presented in immaculate condition. In the ground floor entrance hall, there is a guest cloakroom and coat cupboards. On the first floor is a double aspect open plan kitchen and reception room which is wonderfully bright. On the half landing sits a double bedroom with en-suite shower room and ample built in storage. On the second floor is an excellent principal bedroom with dressing room and en-suite bathroom with shower. There is also over 200 sq ft of eaves storage which is most useful.

The property sits in a peaceful residential area, on the corner of Crabtree Lane and Woodlawn Road. There is a "Little Waitrose" 0.2 miles away and within a short walk are The Crabtree and The River Café. Hammersmith Station (District and Piccadilly Lines) is 0.8 miles away.

address: Television Centre, Wood Lane, London W12
detailedDescription:
This superb, 3 bed duplex apartment is situated on the top two floors of the re-imagined Television Centre and boasts an open plan living space, dual aspect providing ample natural light and two large terraces.

Forming part of the exclusive Architects Series of Premium Apartments in this iconic development this unit was designed by famed architecture firm Piercy & Company. Their signature style of using luxurious materials in creative ways is seen throughout and particularly recognisable in the fluted marble and timber which forms a focal point of the kitchen.

This stunning apartment has also been recently interior designed by the up-and-coming interior designer Franky Ridgeon of far Studio who has used contemporary and traditional pieces to compliment the developments heritage and modern specifications.

Amenities for residents include 24hr concierge service, onsite management team, residents' reception and lounge, co-working space and meeting room, private cinema, landscaped gardens, basement cycle store, car parking and storage units (via separate negotiation), gymnasium with 4 studios, classes and pt availability, swimming pool, Hamman, juice bar and changing facilities.

Enquire for further details.<br /><br />Television Centre is served by three local stations. White City on the Central line provides transport to Bond Street in 12 minutes, Bank in 22 minutes and Canary Wharf in 32 minutes.

Television Centre will be only a short journey from Crossrail, accessible at Ealing Broadway, Paddington and Bond Street. Wood Lane on the Circle and Hammersmith & City lines offers links to Paddington for mainline and Heathrow Express services in 7 minutes and St Pancras International for mainline and Eurostar services in 20 minutes.

Shepherd's Bush Overground station provides quick access to Kensington Olympia in 2 minutes and Chelsea Harbour via Imperial Wharf in 5 minutes.

The West End is a 10-minute drive via the Westway (A40), and London Heathrow is only half an hour by taxi. Walking in West London is a pleasure, with Portobello Road, Westbourne Grove
and Holland Park only a stroll away.

address: St. Peters Square, Hammersmith, London W6
detailedDescription:
Rarely available, sought after garden square location.

Location

St.Peter's Square is a very prestigious location in west London on the borders of Hammersmith and Chiswick, close to the River Thames.
Stamford Brook (District Line) underground station is approximately 0.3 miles across the beautiful garden square. Both the M4 / M40 motorways are within easy access making this location very desirable.

Chiswick is a hugely popular and prosperous large suburb of West London located on the northern side of the River Thames, 6 miles (9.7 km) west of Charing Cross. It was historically an ancient parish in the county of Middlesex, with an agrarian and fishing economy. The name "Chiswick" is of Old English origin meaning "Cheese Farm" and originates from the riverside meadows and farms that are thought to have supported an annual cheese fair on Dukes Meadows up until the 18th century.

The style of property in Chiswick is varied offering everything from mansion flats along the High Road and on Sutton Court Road, to pretty Victorian cottages on the Glebe Estate. Large Victorian detached houses are found in Grove Park, and Arts & Crafts houses throughout Bedford Park. The River front, Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green are lined with elegant Georgian houses ensuring that there is a fantastic variety of property throughout the local area.

Chiswick High Road, famous for its boulevard-style pavements, is full of quality independent outlets and an increasingly up-market selection of high street names which run from Hammersmith through to the Chiswick roundabout. Chiswick is a great place to shop and eat. Tesco, Sainsbury's, Waitrose and Marks and Spencer are all represented. Serving meat lovers are Macken Bros, Wyndham House and Ginger Pig butchers. Covent Garden Fishmongers do as their name suggests. Bayley & Sage have an amazing cheese counter and the Grove Park Deli on Fauconberg Road is also very popular. The Old Cinema provides Antique Vintage Retro Collections. Attractive fruit, vegetable and flower stalls add colour to the High Road. High Street banks, chemists, dry cleaners, beauty spas, fashion shops, off licences and general repair shops as well as many other outlets means there is no need to go elsewhere.

Among Chiswick's fine dining choices are Michelin-starred La Trompette on Devonshire Road and Le Vacherin on South Parade. High Road House and its Brasserie are part of the Soho House empire. Numerous high street restaurants such as Honest Burgers, Cote, Byrons and Pizza Express cater for family tastes.

Lord Burlington's Chiswick House is a picturesque, 18th-century Palladian mansion with gardens designed by William Kent. The birthplace of the English Landscape Movement, the gardens, with their statuary hedges and vistas, has had a £12 million makeover which includes a new café by architects Caruso St John. In recent years Chiswick House grounds have played host to Soho House group's House Festival, enticing the great and the good of the media industry with performers who are both nationally renowned and locally resident.

Bedford Park, London's first garden suburb, was built between 1875 and 1886 as part of the Arts & Crafts revival. Victorian property developer Jonathan Carr instructed lead architect Richard Norman Shaw (alongside ej May, W Wilson and ew Godwin) in the building of a collection of houses and studios that now form a conservation area and are for the most part Grade II listed. Many of these houses feature elements of styling from William Morris, to whose legacy is dedicated the William Morris Society at Kelmscott House on Upper Mall.

Description

St. Peter's Square is a beautiful garden square surrounded by elegant Grade II Listed stucco fronted houses in sought after west London, built circa 1829.

The layout of the ground floor is generously proportioned with many elegant period features. The exceptional entertaining space offers a large double reception room with French doors leading out to a terrace overlooking the fabulous garden. There is also access from this floor out to the garden.

The lower ground floor comprises a spacious open plan kitchen/dining/family room with doors leading out to the garden. There is a cloakroom, a utility room and a very useful storage room which provides access to the front of the house and the vaults.

The first floor provides a wonderful principal bedroom with a balcony overlooking the stunning garden square. The room offers plenty of wardrobes and a large en suite bathroom with further wardrobe space.

The second floor is cleverly configured offering a further three good bedrooms and a family shower room.

This charming family house offers elegant family entertaining space and accommodation, a very successful layout and generous storage including two wine cellars in the vaults.

Square Footage: 2441 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Situated on a pretty tree-lined street, this unusually wide period mid-terrace house sits moments from Parsons Green.

Opening on the ground floor, there is a charming hallway with period detailing leading into the kitchen/dining room and reception room. The open-plan kitchen/dining room is located at the front of the house with 26'10 ft of space. This elegant room features a large bay window allowing for an abundance of light, a traditional feature fireplace, period coving, and a modern light kitchen that has access to the garden.

At the rear of the house is a spacious and contemporary living room that is flooded with natural light and benefits from a traditional feature fireplace. Leading out, there is an enclosed garden that has been laid with brick paving, creating a low maintenance outside space. There is also the potential to add a side return to further maximise internal space (STPP). This floor further benefits a WC and wooden flooring throughout. The basement has potential to convert into a full floor, subject to planning permission.

On the first floor are three bedrooms all with built-in storage, and a shared bathroom. The largest room has been beautifully designed with surrounding built-in wardrobes, a feature fireplace and a balcony.

On the second floor sits an expansive principal bedroom which boasts large eaves storage, a Juliette balcony and skylights which allows for an abundance of natural light. There is a further double bedroom and shared bathroom on this floor.

This house has well thought out accommodation over three floors which have been designed to a high standard and offers the potential for further extension(STPP).

Ringmer Avenue is a pretty cherry tree-lined street within easy reach of Bishops Park, 0.5m from Parsons Green Underground station (District line), and bus routes along Fulham Road and Fulham Palace Road leading to and from the West End.

detailedDescription:

The apartment is finished well throughout and benefits from high ceilings and plenty of natural light.

The charming principle double bedroom features built in wardrobes, sanded floorboards and is very quiet. The further double bedroom, of almost equal size, has skylights and external access to a private and secure small light-well, perfect for morning coffee.

Moving through the property the amount of space and storage is very unique for an apartment in this area, featuring a utility room, understairs cupboard, pantry and further built in storage space.

The kitchen is freestanding and bespoke-made and finished to a high standard with thick white Corian worktops, a dual bowl Butler's sink, original factory pendant lights fittings and wall sconces. Bi-fold doors lead to a private garden with a huge palm which gives beautiful shade in the summer.

detailedDescription:
A top floor two bedroom flat set on one of the most desirable roads in the ever popular 'Bury Triangle.' The property is finished to a good standard throughout and boasts high ceilings, bright living space and a shared garden at the rear of the property.
Subject to planning the property has excellent extension potential into the loft space above.

Snowbury Road is located close to the Wandsworth Bridge Road and offers fantastic accessibility to the many local amenities such as bars, shops and restaurants, as well as the green spaces of South Park and Eel Brook Common. Imperial Wharf station is a ten minute walk away, and Parsons Green and Fulham Broadway are the closest underground stations which are both on the District Line, linking you to the city in minutes. Fantastic local schools include lEcole des Petits and LEcole Marie dOrliac.

address: Hadyn Park Road, Shepherds Bush, London W12
detailedDescription:
A very well presented, one double bedroom flat is ideally positioned on this residential road close to all amenities of the Askew Road and Ravenscourt Park.

Comprises an open plan reception with stylish fitted kitchen, a modern shower cubicle and a double bedroom to the rear.

Early viewing is strongly recommended!

Hadyn Park Road is a popular residential street which runs east/west between the Askew Road and Percy Road. Local amenities are within a short walk including, shops, supermarkets, cafes and restaurants, with the Westfield London also close by on Shepherd's Bush Green. Public transport links are accessed via Goldhawk Road (Hammersmith & City line), Shepherd's Bush Market (Hammersmith & City line) and Shepherd's Bush Green (Central line, Southern Rail and bus station).

address: Brompton Park Crescent, West Brompton SW6
detailedDescription:
The apartment looks out from all rooms to a landscaped pond and across an acre of parkland. It has been fully rebuilt to a high standard. It spans 500 sq ft of space, comprising a reception room with new black-out curtains, all new wood floors, usb and plugs throughout. There are French Doors to a bijoux private, sunny balcony, (perfect for morning coffee). The State of the art fully fitted kitchen has a computer/phone charging station with outlets and usb ports on a quartz work surface. There is under and over counter lighting, a Neff Bake Off Hide n Slide Oven, Neff Induction hob, Neff dishwasher, Franke sink, full size AEG refrigerator and AEG clothes washer/dryer. The double bedroom has wood floors with usb and power points to both sides of the bed, and a full wall of mirrors hiding super storage for hanging clothes and shelving for sweaters/shoes etc. There are two good storage spaces in the hallway behind lovely doors. The full bathroom with Carrera marble sink surround and well lit bevelled mirrors with crystal cabinet pulls. There is storage for towels and all sundries under and over the sink. The bathtub has matching marble tiled walls, a shower over bath, and a separate handheld shower for washing hair without needing to be in the bath.

The flat has its own parking space directly at the front door of the building. It is within walking distance of restaurants, groceries, and cleaners. West Brompton, Earl's Court, and Fulham Road Tube stations are within a five minute walk.

Brompton Park benefits from an on-site swimming pool, sauna, and residents' only fully fitted gym with all machines, and a communal garden with off road jogging opportunities.

detailedDescription:
A house of magnificent proportions, this impressive 5 bedroom end of terrace home exudes style and flair while showcasing many original features throughout. The ground floor offers excellent family and entertaining space with a bright double reception room towards the front of the house and open plan kitchen and dining area towards the rear. The light filled dining area leads to the private, low maintenance patio garden. The upper floors are dedicated to five generous bedrooms, study, three sleek bathrooms and a self contained studio at the top of the house.

Frithville Gardens is a quiet residential street which enters the open spaces of Hammersmith Park and offers easy access to the bbc development with Soho House and a variety of restaurants. The property is conveniently positioned for the many offerings of the Westfield shopping complex, Kensington High Street and Holland Park. Transport links can be found at Shepherds Bush (Central line & London Overground), Shepherds Bush Market (Circle, Hammersmith & City lines) and offers easy access to the M3, M4, M40 and Heathrow. The property benefits from being within the catchment area for St Stephens Primary school.

address: Regent On The River, Fulham SW6
detailedDescription: A delightful two bedroom riverfront apartment on the 4th floor of Ferrymans Quay at the ever popular Regent on the River. The flat is awash with natural light and offers well-proportioned accommodation and has bright, clean, neutral contemporary décor. It comprises two double bedrooms, two bathrooms (one of which is en suite to the master) and a separate kitchen. A balcony with wonderful views across the Thames is accessed from the reception room. Regent on the River enjoys a well-deserved reputation for being a wonderful place to live. There is a sense of community, the communal gardens are beautifully planted and maintained. The concierge service is very helpful and on-site 24 hours a day. In addition there is secure underground parking. All of this combines to produce a genuinely exceptional apartment in a fantastic location. EPC rating C.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Situated on a charming tree lined road just off the Askew Road is this striking split level, two double bedroom flat in a beautiful period building. As the flat is arranged over two floors you get the spacious feel and benefits of a house. As you climb the stairs of the flat you are met with a large contemporary family sized bathroom, up a few steps you have a large eat in kitchen and exceptionally spacious living room. To the second floor is the private decked roof terrace and two generous sized double bedrooms.

Situated moments from Wendell and Ravenscourt parks and the bustling Askew Road with it’s independent retailers, coffee shops, restaurants and supermarkets, it is also within easy reach of Westfield London, Turnham Green Terrace/ Chiswick High Road, Hammersmith and a beautiful stretch of the Thames.
Transport links include Stamford Brook, Ravenscourt Park, Goldhawk Road and Shepherd’s Bush, all within easy reach, as well as the 94,266 and 237 buses.

detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

A smartly presented one double bedroom apartment set on the second floor of the popular Lille Square development, with pleasant views to the rear over the communal gardens. The property has been well maintained and appointed, offering bright and spacious, well proportioned accommodation with high specification finish and stylish interiors. Features include a generous open plan reception/high gloss fitted kitchen, modern bathroom, double glazing, electric heating, quality floor coverings, and long lease. The development itself provides 24 hour concierge service, communal lift, and access to a residents' gym.

Accommodation comprises entrance leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with wide double glazed windows with quiet rear aspect, and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white high gloss wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor, double wall mounted electric oven, and further space for appliances. There is a spacious double bedroom with full height double glazed window, plus a stylish bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

The property is enviably located just a short walk from West Brompton station, with Earls Court and West Kensington stations also close-by, as well as a host of regular bus routes providing unrivalled cross-London links. The area offers an array of exclusive shops, bars, cafes, restaurants and amenities, all within just a short distance, in this superb central location.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

address: Compass House, Chelsea Creek, 5 Park Street, London SW6
detailedDescription:
Exceptional three bedroom apartment in the desirable Chelsea Creek development

Location

Chelsea Creek is a desirable development on the borders of Fulham and Chelsea, arranged around picturesque communal gardens and water features. Whilst being ideally located to take advantage of the popular shops, bars and restaurants of the Kings Road, it is also well connected to the rest of Central London via Imperial Wharf overground station, which offers services north to West Brompton (District Line) and Shepherds Bush (Central Line). It also connects south to Clapham Junction, which is convenient for travelling to Gatwick Airport.

Description

This immaculate apartment is located on the seventh floor of Compass House, benefitting from a prime corner aspect which allows for an abundance of natural light. The spacious reception room is ideal for entertaining and opens up to a generous wrap around balcony on two sides. There is a semi-separate kitchen, which can be opened up to the reception room if desired, and is complete with integrated Miele appliances, including coffee machine and wine fridge. The principle bedroom is equipped with a walk in dressing room, beautifully appointed en suite shower room and a further private balcony. The two further double bedrooms both offer built in storage and enjoy use of a separate guest bathroom. The apartment also comes with the added convenience of a right to park in the development’s secure underground car park. Residents of Chelsea Creek further benefit from excellent 24 hour security and concierge service, plus luxurious private leisure facilities including a state of the art gymnasium, swimming pool and spa.

Square Footage: 1365 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 977 years remaining

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
With views down Stowe Road, this stunning double fronted 4 bedroom property and former show home, offers fantastic lateral accomodation on only 3 floors. The elegant interiors are light and spacious offering the perfect balance between bedroom accommodation, home office and entertainment space.

The ground floor comprises an inviting entrance hallway with a generous eat in kitchen to one side and the family reception room with french doors leading out into the pretty west-facing garden on the other. The fitted kitchen has Miele appliances, stone work surfaces and a dining area at the front by the bay window. The ground floor also has a utility area and cloakroom.

Upstairs, the first floor has a second reception with an abundance of natural light and a master bedroom with a walk-in wardrobe and en suite bathroom. The top floor completes the bedroom accommodation with three further double bedrooms one of which is en suite and a family bathroom.

In addition there is the added benefit of two off-street parking spaces as well as a private garage, with an upper level which is currently being used as a home office.

Havilland Mews is located on Stowe Road which is a quiet and peaceful street in the heart of Shepherds Bush. Westfield Shopping Centre and the amenities of Shepherds Bush, Brook Green, Askew Road and Brackenbury Village are all within easy walking distance. Transport links are at Shepherds Bush (Central Line) and Goldhawk Road (Circle & Hammersmith & City). Ravenscourt Park and numerous primary and secondary schools are right on the property's doorstep.
